questions.question: Which UNESCO World Heritage Site, famous for its iconic rock formations and ancient monastic sites, is located in central Greece?
questions.context: These monasteries are built atop towering rock pillars and were established around the 11th century. Today, they are a popular pilgrimage and tourist destination.

questions.question: What ancient ruin, discovered in 1823 and known for its cliff-side tombs and amphitheater, draws millions of visitors in the Middle East?
questions.context: This archaeological site was the capital of the Nabataean Kingdom and is famous for its stunning rock-cut architecture. It was featured in the film 'Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade'.

questions.question: In which capital city can you find the futuristic Marina Bay Sands, known for its luxury hotel and distinctive rooftop pool?
questions.context: Opened in 2010, this landmark includes a SkyPark which offers a 360-degree view of the cityscape and is integral to Singapore's post-modern city image.

questions.question: Which famous museum in Madrid displays works by Spanish masters like Vel√°zquez and Goya, housed in a grand 18th-century building?
questions.context: It is one of the world's premier art galleries and was founded by Queen Maria Isabel of Braganza in 1819.

questions.question: What ancient ruin, a part of the complex once occupied by a powerful civilization in South America, sits high in the Andes mountains of Peru?
questions.context: Built in the 15th century and abandoned roughly a century later, Machu Picchu was rediscovered by explorer Hiram Bingham in 1911 and is often referred to as the 'Lost City of the Incas'.
